fullWidth.description: For full width / maximum available space

100.description: Default size, used for most components, i.e. checkboxes, tooltips, buttons

200.description: Large size, used for big surfaces and components, i.e. modals, cards, alerts

300.description: Large size, used for big surfaces and components, i.e. modals, cards, alerts

400.description: Large size, used for big surfaces and components, i.e. modals, cards, alerts

500.description: Large size, used for big surfaces and components, i.e. modals, cards, alerts

max.description: Large size, used for unique components, i.e. pills, avatars

100.description: Small shadow used for small components like checkboxes, buttons

200.description: Medium sized shadow for components like dropdowns, tooltips, toast notifications

300.description: Large shadow for components like modals, drawers

neutral.description: Typically used on top of "neutral" and "neutralFaded" backgrounds as well as "page" "pageFaded" and "base" backgrounds. Also used for primary type color.

neutralFaded.description: Typically used on top of "neutral" and "neutralFaded" backgrounds as well as "page" "pageFaded" and "base" backgrounds. Also used for primary type color.

accent.description: Typically used on top of "neutral" and "neutralFaded" backgrounds as well as "page" "pageFaded" and "base" backgrounds. Also used for links.

positive.description: Used for high emphasis "semantic" "positive" foreground elements such as iconography

warning.description: Used for high emphasis "semantic" "warning" foreground elements such as iconography

danger.description: Used for high emphasis "semantic" "danger" foreground elements such as iconography

disabled.description: Used for "disabled" "state" foreground where the user cannot interact with the element. Used in conjunction with "disabled" backgrounds

ghost.description: Used for ultra low emphasis text elements such as placeholder text

onInteractive.description: Used for foreground elements placed on top of any interactive high emphasis semantic background such as background "positive" "warning" and "danger"

onPrimary.description: Used for foreground elements placed on top of "primary" background elements

neutral.description: Used for "component" or "surface" backgrounds where you want to differentiate emphasis

neutralActive.description: Interactive "active" state for "neutral" backgrounds typically used when interacted with

neutralFaded.description: Used for alternative "component" or "surface" backgrounds where you want to differentiate emphasis

positive.description: Used for high emphasis "semantic" "positive" backgrounds such as success states

positiveFaded.description: Used for low emphasis "semantic" "positive" backgrounds such as success states

danger.description: Used for high emphasis "semantic" "danger" backgrounds such as error or fail states

dangerFaded.description: Used for low emphasis "semantic" "danger" backgrounds such as error or fail states

disabled.description: Used for "disabled" "states" backgrounds where the user cannot interact with the element

base.description: Used for "base" backgrounds commonly applied to "cards" and other "surfaces" that might require further interactive states or demarcation

elevated.description: Used for "elevated" backgrounds commonly applied to "modals" and other "surfaces" that are "elevated" above other "surfaces"

primary.description: Used for ultra high emphasis backgrounds (to be used sparingly)

warning.description: Used for high emphasis "semantic" "warning" backgrounds such as alert states

warningFaded.description: Used for low emphasis "semantic" "warning" backgrounds such as alert states

accent.description: Used for "core" "interactive" backgrounds to demarcate controls, actions and general interactivity.

accentFaded.description: Used for lower emphasis "core" "interactive" backgrounds to demarcate controls, actions and general interactivity. Also uses for "semantic" "passive" backgrounds

neutral.description: Used for "component" or "surface" borders where you want to differentiate emphasis. (used with "neutral" backgrounds

neutralHover.description: Interactive "hover" state for "neutral" borders. Used with "neutral" backgrounds

neutralActive.description: Interactive "active" state for "neutral" borders. Used with "neutral" backgrounds

neutralFaded.description: Interactive "active" state for "neutral" borders. Used with "neutral" backgrounds

neutralFadedHover.description: Interactive "hover" state for "neutralFaded" borders. Used with "neutralFaded" backgrounds

neutralFadedActive.description: Interactive "active" state for "neutralFaded" borders. Used with "neutralFaded" backgrounds

positive.description: Used for "semantic" "postive" borders. Used with high emphasis "positive" backgrounds.

positiveFaded.description: Used for "semantic" "positive" borders. Used with low emphasis "positiveFaded" backgrounds.

danger.description: Used for "semantic" "danger" borders. Used with high emphasis "danger" backgrounds.

dangerHover.description: Interactive "hover" state for "danger" borders. Used with "danger" backgrounds

dangerActive.description: Interactive "active" state for "danger" borders. Used with "danger" backgrounds

dangerFaded.description: Used for "semantic" "danger" borders. Used with low emphasis "dangerFaded" backgrounds.

disabled.description: Used for "disabled" "states" borders where the user cannot interact with the element. used with "disabled" backgrounds

warning.description: Used for "semantic" "warning" borders. Used with high emphasis "warning" backgrounds.

warningFaded.description: Used for "semantic" "warningFaded" borders. Used with low emphasis "warningFaded" backgrounds.

accent.description: Used for "core" "interactive" borders to demarcate controls, actions and general interactivity. Used with "accent" backgrounds

accentHover.description: Interactive "hover" state for "accent" borders. Used with "accent" backgrounds

accentActive.description: Interactive "active" state for "danger" borders. Used with "accent" backgrounds

accentFaded.description: Used for lower emphasis "core" "interactive" borders to demarcate controls, actions and general interactivity. Also uses for "semantic" "passive" borders. Used with "accentFaded" backgrounds

primary.description: Used for ultra high emphasis borders. Used with "Primary" backgrounds

base.description: Used for "base" borders commonly applied to "cards" and other "surfaces" that might require further interactive states or demarcation. Used with "base" backgrounds

baseHover.description: Interactive "hover" state for "base" borders. Used with "base" backgrounds

baseActive.description: Interactive "active" state for "base" borders. Used with "base" backgrounds

body100.description: Used for short body copy with no more than 4 lines within sections.

body200.description: Used for short body copy with no more than 4 lines within sections.

bodyM200.description: Used for short body copy with no more than 4 lines within sections.

body250.description: Used for short body copy with no more than 4 lines within sections.

body300.description: Used for short body copy with no more than 4 lines within sections.

label100.description: Used for most components as the first and second level of information hirearchy.

label200.description: Used for most components as the first and second level of information hirearchy.

label300.description: commonly used for secondary levels of information within components.

label400.description: commonly used for secondary levels of information within components.

helper.description: Used for Helper text, tooltips and inline validation for user input components.

badge.description: Used for Helper text, tooltips and inline validation for user input components.

badgeM.description: Used for Helper text, tooltips and inline validation for user input components.

display100.description: Used for large brand or marketing aligned messaging. Commonly found on landing pages and not used within B2B product.

display200.description: Used for extra large brand or marketing aligned messaging. Commonly found on landing pages and not used within B2B product.

title100.description: Used for subheadings typicaly no longer than one word.

title200.description: Used for small headings typicaly no longer than one word in tables and cards.

titleM200.description: Used for small headings typicaly no longer than one word in tables and cards.

title300.description: Used for small headings typicaly no longer than one word in tables and cards.

title400.description: Used for small headings and subsection headings. commonly found in modals.

title500.description: Used for medium to small layout or section titles.

title600.description: Used for large layout and page titles with no more than 3-4 words or where a line break does not occure.

neutralFaded.description: Used for secondary text and icon color

accent.description: Used for accent text and icon color

accentActive.description: Interactive active state for accent foreground elements

primary.description: Default text color. Used as the main text color for the emails. Provides good and legible contrast for our content.

secondary.description: @hardCoded - Secondary text color. Used for less important text.

footer.description: [Should be merged with secondary text color] Used for the text color in the footer.

link.description: Default link text color. Used for all paragraph level links in emails.

stroke.description: Border color of the container box

default.description: @hardCoded - Color for horizontal lines to split content
